title: Pesto Dip
description: A creamy and herby pesto dip perfect for chips or vegetables.
instructions: In blender or food processor, blend all ingredients until almost smooth.
Cover and chill.

title: Ginger Lime Dip
description: A tangy and refreshing dip with a kick of ginger, perfect as a companion for fruit or crackers.
instructions: Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Cover, chill, and serve with fruit.

title: Sweet Sour Chicken Wings
description: A tangy and sweet chicken wing dish with a combination of vinegar, pineapple juice, soy sauce, and spices.
instructions: Brown chicken on all sides in hot fat in a large heavy skillet.
Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan; cook to boiling, then simmer 5 min.
Pour over chicken; cook, covered, on low heat 20 min.
Uncover & cook 15 min, or until chicken is tender.

title: Shrimp Louis Dip
description: A creamy and savory dip with a base of mayonnaise and sour cream, enhanced with fresh shrimp, green pepper, and a kick of horseradish.
instructions: Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Cover and chill.

title: French Onion Dip
description: A classic creamy dip flavored with French onion soup mix.
instructions: Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Cover and chill.

ingredients.name: Knorr French onion soup & recipe mix

title: Bacon Horseradish Dip
description: A rich dip with bold flavors of bacon and horseradish.
instructions: Stir bacon bits into mayonnaise and sour cream.
Add prepared horseradish.
Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Cover and chill.

title: Green Onion Dip
description: A fresh and zesty dip with green onions and Dijon mustard.
instructions: Stir sliced green onions and parsley into mayonnaise and sour cream.
Add Dijon mustard and minced garlic.
Blend or process until almost smooth.
Cover and chill.

title: Canning Carrots, Corn, Beans
description: Home canning process for preserving carrots, corn, and beans.
instructions: Wash and peel carrots.
Cut corn from cob.
Wash, snip green or yellow beans.
Cut into desired pieces.
Pack loosely into pint jars.
Add 1/2 tsp canning salt per pint jar.
Fill jar with boiling water.
Put on lid and band, screw on firmly.
Boil in hot water bath for 3 hours.

title: 48-Hour Crock Pickles
description: A traditional crock pickle recipe requiring 48 hours of brining.
instructions: Place pickles in pail along with some dill, onion, and garlic.
Mix together vinegar, water, sugar and salt.
Pour over sliced, speared, or whole cucumbers.
Let stand for 48 hours.
Can boil brine and pour over cucumbers in jars.

title: Frozen Sweet Dill Pickles
description: Sweet dill pickles recipe that is frozen for preservation and taste.
instructions: Mix together salt, sugar, and cider vinegar.
Let set for 2 hours.
Drain, but DO NOT rinse.
Add dillweed to taste.
Let set until sugar dissolves and liquid covers cucumbers.
Put in freezer containers with 1 inch space.
Freeze.

title: Hot Artichoke Dip
description: A creamy, cheesy artichoke dip that's perfect for parties.
instructions: Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Spoon into a small ovenproof dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

title: Guacamole Dip
description: A fresh, tangy guacamole dip perfect for dipping or as a spread.
instructions: Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Cover.
Chill.
Serve.

title: Spinach Dip
description: A savory spinach dip with a mix of spinach and herbs, great for entertaining.
instructions: Stir all ingredients until well mixed.
Cover.
Chill.

title: Egg Nog
description: A classic holiday egg nog with a blend of eggs, milk, ice cream, and a hint of brandy or rum.
instructions: Separate the eggs.
Beat egg whites, add 3/4 cup sugar and beat.
In a separate bowl, beat egg yolks, add 1/4 cup sugar and beat.
Mix egg mixtures together.
Add milk and brandy or rum and mix.
Float half a gallon of vanilla ice cream in bowl with mixture.
Sprinkle each serving with nutmeg.

title: Beef Kebabs
description: Savory beef kebabs marinated in a blend of chablis, soy sauce, and seasonings, grilled with vegetables.
instructions: Mix chablis, Worcestershire sauce, honey, soy sauce, grated ginger root, and pineapple juice for marinade.
Cut sirloin steak into 1" cubes.
Skewer alternately with vegetables.
Marinate in the refrigerator for up to two days.
Grill until beef is done to your taste.

title: Chicken Casserole
description: Hearty chicken casserole with cheese, celery, and a crispy fried onion topping.
instructions: Skin chicken and boil in pot of water for 2 minutes.
Let chicken simmer in pot at low heat for 15-20 minutes.
Drain and let chicken cool for 15 minutes.
Debone chicken and cut into bite-size pieces.
In a bowl, mix remaining ingredients, except fried onions.
Add chicken pieces.
Place in casserole dish and bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees.
Top with fried onions.

title: Beef Shish-Kabob
description: Marinated beef cubes skewered with assorted vegetables.
instructions: In a deep bowl, combine all ingredients except meat; mix well.
Add meat to the marinade and stir to coat.
Refrigerate overnight or let stand at room temperature for 2 or 3 hours, turning meat occasionally.
Skewer with assorted vegetables like green & red peppers, mushrooms, onion, and zucchini chunks.

ingredients.name: lean beef round, sirloin cut in 1 1/2 inch cubes

title: Chicken Kiev
description: A classic Chicken Kiev recipe where chicken breasts are stuffed with flavorful butter, coated in breadcrumbs, and baked.
instructions: Prepare chicken.
Mix margarine, parsley, chives, onions, salt, and pepper.
Shape the mixture into 6 sticks and chill or freeze.
Place chicken breast between two pieces of wax paper and pound with a mallet.
Place 1 stick of butter mixture on each breast, roll, and close edges with picks.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
Beat eggs and water.
Dredge breasts with flour, dip in egg, then roll in breadcrumbs.
Saute in margarine until brown.
Bake for 20 minutes.

title: Meatloaf
description: A traditional meatloaf recipe with a savory blend of spices and condiments.
instructions: Mix lean hamburger, bread crumbs or oats, eggs, chopped onion, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Pack into a loaf pan.
Place bacon strips on top.
Bake at 375 for 60 min.
Optionally, put a can of beef gravy over top & place potatoes, carrots & onions around the meat.
Bake until vegetables are done.

title: Pork Roast, Grilled
description: Grilled pork roast glazed with a sweet and tangy sauce.
instructions: Prepare the grill for the pork roast.
Mix baby food peaches, brown sugar, cider vinegar, ginger, catsup, garlic powder, and soy sauce.
Bring all ingredients except pork roast to a boil.
Use mixture to baste roast.

title: Venison Beer Stew
description: A hearty stew with venison and vegetables, simmered in beer for a rich flavor.
instructions: Crumble bacon, set aside. Coat venison with flour.
Brown bacon drippings, drain off fat. Add undrained tomatoes, beer, onion, bouillon, sugar, thyme, black & red peppers. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover, simmer 1 1/2 hours.
Add carrots, turnip, celery, cover, simmer 30 min more. Stir in frozen peas. Cook 5 min. Stir in bacon.
Spoon into serving bowls. Serve with crackers.

title: 4 Hour Beef Stew
description: A classic beef stew, slow-cooked with vegetables and thickened with tapioca.
instructions: Put meat & vegetables in pan.
Mix salt, sugar & tapioca into tomato sauce.
Pour over meat & vegetables.
Cover, bake at 250 degrees for 4 hours.

title: Country Style Veal Roast
description: A savory veal roast with carrots and onion, flavored with marjoram and mushroom soup, perfect for a homely dinner.
instructions: Put roast to one side in pan, add carrots, onion.
Cook 5 min, skim off fat. Add water, undiluted soup, salt, pepper, marjoram & bay leaf, bring to boil.
Stirring constantly, reduce heat to low, cover & simmer 2 1/2 to 3 hours until meat is fork tender.
To serve, place meat on warm platter, discard bay leaf. Pour pan liquid into gravy boat.

title: Venison Stroganoff
description: A delicious twist on the classic stroganoff, featuring venison and a rich, creamy mushroom sauce, served over noodles.
instructions: Saute chopped onion in olive oil, add minced garlic to taste.
Add meat & brown. Add remaining ingredients except sour cream. Cover, simmer 30 min until meat is tender.
Stir in sour cream. Serve over cooked noodles.

title: Chicken & Shrimp Jambalaya
description: A flavorful jambalaya with chicken, shrimp, and ham, mixed with rice and spiced with thyme, cayenne, and parsley.
instructions: Heat butter in large heavy skillet. Brown chicken, a few pieces at a time, transfer to casserole.
Add onion & garlic to skillet, saute over medium heat, stirring frequently, 3 to 5 min. Add rice, cook, stirring until rice is opaque but not brown, about 5 min.
Stir in tomatoes, broth, parsley, salt, thyme, & cayenne. Heat just to boil, pour over chicken. Cover, bake at 325 degrees for 30 min.
Stir gently to blend rice & chicken; add peppers, shrimp, & ham. Cover, bake 30 to 40 min, stirring once or twice until chicken is tender. Garnish with parsley when serving, if desired.

ingredients.name: small fresh or frozen shrimp, shelled, deveined

title: Sauerkraut-Kielbasa Oven Dinner
description: A baked dish featuring sauerkraut and kielbasa with apples, onions, and potatoes, seasoned with a chicken gravy mix and caraway seeds.
instructions: Spoon sauerkraut into oven cooking bag, top with kielbasa, apples, potatoes & onions.
In a small bowl, combine gravy mix, water & caraway seeds; pour over ingredients in bag.
Close bag with twist tie to contain entire bag, make 4 small holes along top of bag with scissors or fork.
Bake at 375 degrees for 1 1/2 hours. Carefully lift bag onto large platter or serving dish; cut on corner or edge of bag & empty contents onto platter.

title: Old English Ragout
description: A hearty beef stew with onions, carrots, eggplant, and beer, thickened with a pot roast seasoned gravy mix.
instructions: Put meat & vegetables into oven cooking bag.
In a small bowl, combine gravy mix & beer, pour over ingredients in bag.
Close bag with twist tie, make 4 small holes in top of bag.
Bake 375 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

title: Christmas Morning Italian Strata
description: An Italian-inspired layered casserole with sausage, mushrooms, cheese, and bread, perfect for a holiday breakfast or brunch.
instructions: Grease baking dish, cook pork sausage meat in skillet over medium heat until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink. Using slotted spoon, remove sausage to paper towels to drain.
Cut French bread into 1/2" cubes. Drain & chop mushrooms.
In baking dish, combine sausage, bread cubes & mushrooms.
Whisk together eggs, milk, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, & pepper. Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture. Cover with plastic wrap & refrigerate overnight.
Preheat oven to 350Â°F. Bake strata, uncovered, for 1 hour. Remove from oven & sprinkle evenly with mozzarella & Cheddar cheeses. Bake 15 min longer or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Remove from oven; let stand 10 min. Garnish with chopped parsley.

title: Baked Beans
description: A classic baked beans recipe with ground beef, bacon, and a sweet and savory sauce.
instructions: Brown beef & drain, mix with beans & ketchup.
Cook on low heat 15 min. Add other ingredients, bake 1 hour at 375 degrees.

title: Sauerkraut Noodle Dish
description: A hearty dish of sauerkraut and noodles, enriched with bacon, mushrooms, and onions.
instructions: Fry bacon, set aside. In bacon grease, saute chopped onions.
Add sauerkraut and fry until tender, about 1 hr, adding a little water if necessary.
Saute mushrooms in butter and add to cooked kraut.
Cook and drain kluski noodles and add to cooked sauerkraut.

title: Marquette Vegetable Salad
description: A refreshing vegetable salad with a creamy dill dressing, topped with olives and hard-boiled eggs.
instructions: Mix sour cream, mayo, dill, parsley flakes, seasoned salt, and onion salt for dressing.
Pour dressing over cauliflower, cherry tomatoes, sliced red onion, black olives, broccoli, and sliced hard boiled eggs.

title: 5-Layer Macaroni Pile-Up
description: A layered macaroni dish with cheese, vegetables, and bacon, served with a tangy salad dressing.
instructions: Prepare dinner as directed on package of macaroni.
Combine salad dressing, onions, mustard. Mix well. Add to macaroni.
In 12 x 8 baking dish, layer half of macaroni mixture, lettuce, tomatoes, and peas.
Cover with remaining macaroni mixture. Press mixture to edges to seal.
Cover, refrigerate several hours or overnight.
Top with crumbled bacon just before serving.
